english: Qin Shi Huang (first emperor of Qin)

etymology.description: 秦 (Qin) + 始皇 (first emperor) = First Emperor of Qin.
etymology.interpretation: Refers to Yíng Zhèng, who unified the Warring States in 221 BCE and adopted the new imperial title 皇帝, hence styled as 秦始皇(帝). Often understood as the abbreviation of 秦始皇帝, meaning “the first emperor of the Qin.”

parts.english: Qin state; Qin dynasty; surname Qin; the Qin polity
first emperor; founding emperor; primal sovereign

examples.chinese: 秦始皇统一六国，建立了秦朝(秦始皇統一六國，建立了秦朝)。
examples.pinyin: Qín Shǐhuáng tǒngyī liù guó, jiànlì le Qíncháo.
examples.english: Qin Shi Huang unified the Six States and founded the Qin dynasty.

examples.chinese: 许多兵马俑是为秦始皇的陵墓而制(許多兵馬俑是為秦始皇的陵墓而製)。
examples.pinyin: Xǔduō bīngmǎyǒng shì wèi Qín Shǐhuáng de língmù ér zhì.
examples.english: Many terracotta warriors were made for Qin Shi Huang’s mausoleum.

examples.chinese: 历史学家讨论秦始皇的功过(歷史學家討論秦始皇的功過)。
examples.pinyin: Lìshǐxuéjiā tǎolùn Qín Shǐhuáng de gōngguò.
examples.english: Historians debate Qin Shi Huang’s merits and faults.
